title: Due Diligence Team Lead
description:
Company Description

Wise is a global technology company, building the best way to move and manage the world’s money. Min fees. Max ease. Full speed.

Whether people and businesses are sending money to another country, spending abroad, or making and receiving international payments, Wise is on a mission to make their life easier and save them money.

As part of our team, you will be helping us create an entirely new network for the world's money. For everyone, everywhere.

More about our mission and what we offer .


Job Description

Strategically guide the Due Diligence Team to achieve operational goals and maximize business impact. The primary focus will be on people development, processes enhancement, and productivity management. Your overall objective is to analyze data, behaviors, maintain morale, and drive for sustainable results that are aligned with the KYC Department’s strategy and goals.

Duties and responsibilities:

  • Evaluate your team’s performance, both on an individual and team level ensuring team members adhere to company and department policies while achieving their individual and team goals.
  • Develop and maintain team performance metrics consistent with the KYC department goals, and track performance of said goals.
  • Have regular individual performance and morale discussions with all your team members at least twice per month.
  • Foster an inclusive and engaging environment to ensure the morale and productivity of your team.
  • Contribute to the growth of your team through forecasting, strategizing and hiring.
  • Bring a client-focused and holistic approach to decision making to identify the root cause of issues.
  • Manage several projects simultaneously with a sense of urgency while working with partners and stakeholders.
  • Identify strategies to continually improve the client experience and ensure your team strives for the highest standards of performance.
  • Liaison with cross teams to ensure procedures are up to date, negotiating where possible to ensure the client experience is prioritized while adhering to regulatory requirements.
  • Deliver key measurables in a timely, professional and ethical manner to ensure dependability and sustainability of results.
  • Drive continuous improvements to quality of data, productivity reporting and associated metrics to improve and maximize the KYC strategy.

  • Please apply by submitting your resume and cover letter in English. Applications in Portuguese will not be considered.

Additional Information

title: Human Resources People Partner
description:
Local People Partner

São Paulo, Brazil

Office based 4 days per week and 1 day working from home

We are seeking a proactive and experienced Local HR People Partner (LPP) to support our organisation’s strategic and operational goals. As an LPP, you will serve as a key advisor, working closely with leadership and line managers to drive people strategies that align with the business objectives. You will play a pivotal role in shaping a high-performance culture, promoting diversity and inclusion, and contributing to the overall success of our teams.

Key Responsibilities:

  1. Strategic Partnership: Work collaboratively with senior leaders and managers to understand the organisation's goals and translate these into effective people strategies and initiatives.
  2. Employee Relations: Provide expert advice on complex employee relations issues, ensuring compliance with employment legislation and organisational policies. Manage conflict resolution and lead investigations when necessary.
  3. Talent Management: Partner with leaders to develop and implement talent development and succession planning strategies. Oversee the performance management cycle, offering guidance on goal setting, feedback, and performance improvement plans.
  4. Change Management: Act as a change agent, supporting business transformation initiatives. Design and deliver change management strategies to support the evolution of our workforce.
  5. Workforce Planning: Assist in forecasting future workforce needs and implementing recruitment strategies to attract top talent. Collaborate with managers to assess and address skills gaps.
  6. Learning & Development: Promote a culture of continuous learning by working with the L&D team to identify and facilitate relevant training and development programmes.
  7. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DEI): Champion DEI initiatives to foster a more inclusive and equitable work environment. Support the implementation of strategies that promote belonging and respect for all employees.
  8. HR Analytics & Reporting: Utilise data to drive people decisions and provide regular reporting on HR metrics, such as turnover, retention, and employee engagement. Offer insights to inform business strategy.
  9. Policy & Compliance: Ensure HR policies and procedures are up to date and in line with UK employment law. Provide guidance on HR best practices and legislative compliance.
  10. Wellbeing & Engagement: Drive initiatives to enhance employee wellbeing and engagement, ensuring employees feel supported and valued.
  11. Payroll: Support local country leader and the payroll department in payroll delivery.

Skills & Experience Required:

  • Proven experience in an HRBP or junior HR advisory role, preferably in a fast-paced, complex organisation.
  • Degree in Human Resources, Business Management, or related field is preferred.
  • Strong knowledge of Brazilian employment legislation and its practical application in a business environment.
  • Commercially savvy with a strong understanding of business operations and strategic thinking.
  • Exceptional interpersonal, negotiation, and influencing skills. Ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organisation.
  • A solutions-oriented approach with a proven track record of delivering results and handling complex HR matters.
  • Experience with HR analytics and the ability to interpret data to inform strategic decisions.
  • Ability to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic environment, with flexibility to adapt to changing business needs.
  • High level of integrity and discretion in handling sensitive information.

Desirable Attributes:

  • Experience in an international or multi-site environment.
  • Familiarity with HR technology and systems (e.g., HRIS, ATS).
  • Organised with strong attention to detail.
  • Fluent in English and Portuguese.

title: Mid-level Backend Software Engineer | CARE
description:
Your wellbeing matters. Join a company that cares.

GET TO KNOW US

Wellhub (formerly Gympass) is a corporate wellness platform that connects employees to the best partners for fitness, mindfulness, therapy, nutrition, and sleep, all included in one subscription designed to cost less than each individual partner. Founded in 2012 and headquartered in NYC, we have a growing global team in 11 countries. At Wellhub, you have the opportunity to build a career in a high-growth tech company that places wellbeing at the foundation of its culture, and contribute to making every company a wellness company.

THE OPPORTUNITY

We are hiring a Mid-level Backend Software Engineer for our CARE team in Brazil ! Join our growing CARE team at Wellhub and help us build the next generation of AI-powered solutions. This role focuses on generative AI, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) + LLMs fine-tuning, and data pipelines. Talented software engineers of any area who would like to shift their career to investing in AI are welcome to apply if they match some of the qualifications and preferred qualifications listed below. Such candidates must be avid learners and be prepared to learn fast.

YOUR IMPACT

  • Work closely with cross-functional teams including product managers, designers, and other engineers;
  • Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to peers;
  • Communicate technical concepts and project progress effectively to non-technical stakeholders;
  • Take part in incident resolution and troubleshooting in the production;
  • Follow-up engineering and product KPIs;
  • Design and develop APIs to interface with various AI models and services;
  • Ensure APIs are secure, scalable, and performant;
  • Ensure seamless integration of our AI applications with other software systems, enhancing interoperability and functionality.
  • Live the mission: inspire and empower others by genuinely caring for your own well-being and that of your colleagues.

WHO YOU ARE

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or a related field;
  • Strong skills in programming languages such as Python, Go, or Java;
  • Experienced in working with SQL/NoSQL technologies (e.g., OpenSearch, DynamoDB, PostgreSQL) understanding common use cases and performance pitfalls;
  • Experience with API development and integration;
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail;
  • Strong communication and teamwork skills;
  • Able to work efficiently on high scalable and distributed projects;
  • Proven experience with projects where the scope is not clearly defined;
  • Faster learner, easily adapting to new technologies quickly and efficiently;
  • Passionate and proven experience to build reliable minimum viable products and pilots in a short amount of time.

We recognize that individuals approach job applications differently. We strongly encourage all aspiring applicants to go for it, even if they don't match the job description 100%. For this specific role, please note that prior experience with API development and integration and working with Python, Golang, or Java are mandatory requirements.

WHAT WE OFFER YOU

We're a wellness company that is committed to the health and well-being of our employees. Our flexible program allows you to customize your benefits according to your needs!

WELLNESS: Health, dental, and life insurance.

FLEXIBLE WORK: At Wellhub, flexibility fosters a happier, healthier, and more productive work environment for everyone. As a Flexible First company, we offer two work model options: flexible hybrid and full remote.

FLEXIBLE SCHEDULE: Wellhubbers and their leaders can make the best decisions for their scope, including flexibility to adjust their working hours based on their personal schedule.

WELLHUB: We believe in our mission and encourage our employees and their families to take care of their well-being too.

PAID TIME OFF: We know how important it is that our employees take time away from work to recharge. Vacations after 6 months and 3 days off per year + 1 day off for each year of tenure (up to 5 additional days) + extra day off for your birthday.

PAID PARENTAL LEAVE: We offer 100% paid parental leave to all new parents and extended maternity leave.

CAREER GROWTH: Outstanding opportunities for personal and career growth.

CULTURE: An exciting and supportive atmosphere with ambitious people from around the world!

Diversity, Equity, and Belonging at Wellhub

We aim to create a collaborative, supportive, and inclusive space where everyone knows they belong. Wellhub is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

Questions on how we treat your personal data? See our Aviso de Privacidade para Candidatos.
